intro: Navarretia jaredii, commonly known as Jared's fairyshade, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the flowering plant family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as hillsides and meadows. Navarretia jaredii is a short-lived perennial, often reaching heights of only a few inches. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and botanical contexts.
